value.title: DeepSeek Sets Sights on AI Search and Agents, Job Postings Show
value.content: DeepSeek is looking to broaden its AI offerings with new artificial intelligence search features and more emphasis on agents, ramping up competition with US firms like OpenAI and Alphabet Inc.’s Google.

value.title: Musk Says Tesla Needs to Build Its Own Factory to Make Chips
value.content: Elon Musk said Tesla Inc. needs to build and operate what he is calling a “TeraFab” to manufacture semiconductors, a massive undertaking that will cost billions of dollars and mark another expansion beyond what had been the company’s core electric vehicle business.

value.title: Sony, Singapore’s GIC to Invest $2 Billion in Music Catalogs
value.content: Sony Music Group and Singapore’s GIC Pte sovereign wealth fund are forming a joint venture to acquire music copyrights, with plans to invest $2 billion to $3 billion in the project.

value.title: Advantest Surges After Raising Forecast on Strong Earnings
value.content: Advantest Corp. shares jumped as much as 14% to a record high after the company beat earnings estimates and raised its forecast.

value.title: Meta Leans on Improved Ad Business to Fuel Massive AI Spending
value.content: Meta Platforms Inc.’s better-than-expected sales outlook helped ease Wall Street concerns about plans for unprecedented spending on artificial intelligence this year.

value.title: Samsung’s Chip Profit Soars in Strong Signal for Global AI Rush
value.content: Samsung Electronics Co.’s chip unit beat expectations with a more than five-fold gain in profit, a healthy signal for an artificial intelligence spending wave that’s triggered a surge in memory demand.

value.title: IBM Posts Revenue That Tops Estimates on Software Gains
value.content: International Business Machines Corp. reported quarterly sales that topped analysts’ estimates on strong growth for its closely watched software unit.

value.title: Microsoft Drops Amid Slowing Cloud Growth, Record Spending
value.content: Microsoft Corp.’s spending surged to a record high and cloud sales growth slowed, sending the shares down sharply amid investor concerns that it could take longer than expected for the company’s AI investments to pay off.

value.title: Bumble, Panera Bread, CrunchBase, Match Hit by Cyberattacks
value.content: A wave of cyberattacks has hit Bumble Inc., Panera Bread Co., Match Group Inc., and CrunchBase Inc., as cybersecurity experts warn about a new round of social engineering attacks targeting US companies.

value.title: Microsoft’s AI Sparkle Is Fading
value.content: Microsoft is spending more on AI than even Wall Street had feared, explains Bloomberg Opinion columnist Dave Lee. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: ServiceNow Strong Results Overshadowed by AI Disruption Fear
value.content: ServiceNow Inc. gave a sales outlook in the current quarter that was stronger than expected, but failed to reduce investor anxieties that artificial intelligence will disrupt the software maker’s business.

value.title: Tesla Plans $2 Billion Investment in Musk’s xAI
value.content: Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports on Tesla's plans to invest about $2 billion into xAI, giving Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence startup a cash infusion despite a shareholder vote last year that failed to win approval. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Shareholders Have No Say in Tesla, Gerber Says
value.content: Ross Gerber, president, CEO and co-founder of Gerber Kawasaki, says shareholders have no say in how Tesla CEO Elon Musk runs the company. Gerber reacts to the latest earnings and Tesla planning to invest $2 billion in xAI. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Zuckerberg Is Doing the Right Thing for Meta, Futurum Group CEO Says
value.content: The Futurum Group CEO Daniel Newman says Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg has "turned the corner" on "Bloomberg The Close." Meta said first-quarter sales will be $53.5 billion to $56.5 billion, beating the $51.3 billion average analyst estimate. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Microsoft Is Well-Positioned for AI, Gabelli's Belton Says
value.content: John Belton, Gabelli Funds portfolio manager and managing director for growth portfolios, reacts to Microsoft's second-quarter earnings on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Microsoft to Outperform This Year, D.A. Davidson's Luria Says
value.content: "Azure is still winning," Gil Luria, D.A. Davidson head of technology research, says while reacting to Microsoft's second-quarter earnings report on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Universal Music Buys Stake in Superfan App to Foster Artist Connections
value.content: The world’s largest record label is looking for ways to build loyalty and make more money from fans

value.title: Amazon Cutting 16,000 Jobs, ASML Reports Record Bookings | Bloomberg Tech 1/28/2026
value.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Amazon’s plans to cut nearly 5% of its corporate workforce. Plus, ASML posts record fourth-quarter orders as AI drives demand for its most sophisticated chipmaking equipment. And, sources tell Bloomberg that SoftBank is in talks to invest as much as $30 billion more in OpenAI.  (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Robinhood to Vie for Key Retail Role in Mega SpaceX IPO
value.content: Robinhood Markets Inc., the upstart broker credited with getting young people hooked on trading, is vying for a key role in SpaceX’s blockbuster initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.

value.title: Fintech Company Alkami Taps Adviser Explores Sale
value.content: Alkami Technology Inc., the financial-technology company that’s come under pressure from an activist investor, is exploring options including a potential sale, according to people familiar with the matter.
